title: seasalts
author: seasalts
content: I have mined some coins and want to share with people. Prefer a faucet website, people click one or twice a day, input the wallet address and send it automatically. No ads, no task, no redirect etc...do not know any facuet website can do that

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: The faucet website that you are describing is too good to be true. How will this faucet will be profitable to the owner if they don't have source of income to give to there user. Can you provide the link to the faucet that you want to share to check if it's legit or not. This offer is really shady unless they just give a very small reward that is just a fraction of the captcha profit because that will seems reasonable at all.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: You didn't describe what type of coin you want to give. Anyway, there are various code base about faucet that might suit your needs, but you need to integrate it with your own coin daemon/node and set up the claim limit system according to your own. Refer to https://github.com/search?q=faucet.With that in mind, you should have knowledge about web development to make that kind of faucet, there is no one-click solution. If you didn't have any, you might want to reach out to the community in case someone interested to develop it.

comments.author: Kocret02
comments.body: You have to be careful because there are lots of crypto faucet-style scams that are rife in the world of digital assets. One of the most common forms of scam is a faucet wallet.In this scheme, the site or organizer will invite you to create a wallet and deposit coins.After you deposit coins and perform some tasks, you are asked to make a withdrawal.At first glance nothing strange. Until finally you did not succeed in making a withdrawal even though you had clicked the withdraw button many times. That means, your coins have disappeared from being taken by the provider's site.
